iati-activity.title: Response to Gaza Humanitarian Crisis 2009
iati-activity.description: To support impartial, neutral humanitarian agencies in their work to: • Assist the wounded needing follow up care, vulnerable, displaced, resident and refugee civilians through integrated humanitarian assistance • Reduce immediate security and protection threats to civilians• Promote increased and predictable access for humanitarian agencies through a safe, enabling and coordinated humanitarian environment within which agencies can work and provide support directly to beneficiaries and to the concerned authorities • Ensure that all parties to the on –going conflict, including militias and irregulars, are aware of and fully abide by their obligations under International Humanitarian Law – and in particular with regard to the treatment of civilians and the provision of humanitarian assistance

iati-activity.title: Palestinian Market Development Programme to Strengthen the Private Sector in the Occupied Palestinian Territories (OPTs)
iati-activity.description: To improve the competitiveness of the Palestinian private sector by i) providing matching grants and technical assistance to mitigate the risk associated with business development, ii) undertaking market analysis to identify and address market failures, iii) strengthening inward investment and transfer of know how. This will benefit at least 480 companies leading to develop about 250 new products and enter 350 new markets. This contributes towards our MDG’s by reducing the rate of Palestinians below the national poverty line to 13% in 2014.

iati-activity.description: To improve conditions for the conflict affected population in Gaza by supporting the International Committee of the Red Cross, to provide (for example) medical care, materials for repairs to damaged houses and emergency repairs for water infrastructure. The International Committee of the Red Cross provides approximately 85,000 conflict-affected people in the Occupied Palestinian Territories with direct assistance, and supports approximately 1.6 million indirectly through its protection activities (which include monitoring adherence to international law including access to humanitarian assistance
